text:
April 9, 1958
Dr* I* Keith Tyler, Director
Institute for Education by Radio-TV
Ohio State University
Columbus, Ohio
Dear Keith:
1 find myself in an extremely erabarrasing position*
I received a letter from you a week or so ago and am unable
to locate it now. It arrived in the midst of a terrible
crisis* My secretary was ill for a week and a half and,
as you can well imagine, the Television Center was in a very
chaotic state from which we will not completely recover for
some time* Anyway, I want to apologize for the delay in
responding and for not having your letter here for reference.
Unfortunately, I will be unable to make the Ohio State
Institute this year. I have recently received notice that I
was awarded a grant by the Fund for Adult Education for a year
of post-doctoral study at Columbia University in the area of
attitude measurement. This means that I have a great many
unfinished projects to complete in a hurry. 1 must finish the
analysis and report on our experiment in methods of teaching
communications skills for the Fund for the Advancement of
Education and must complete another study on audience reaction
to educational television programs for ETRC before I leave.
I am already committed to four meetings away from Iowa City
before X leave for the year and do not believe that it will
be possible to be away more*
Sorry that I will not be able to make it. It would be
good to participate and to see you again. Thank you very
much for the invitation. Again, I hope that you will excuse
the delayed response.
Cordially,
SLB:mw
Sam L. Becker
Director, Division of
Television-Radio-Film
